game_description: Designing 3D structures is complicated. We want to make it easy for you to bring your ideas into the real world. Now you can design at scale, prototype your creations and determine exactly which parts you need to get the job done.
review_1: I'm doing a small woodworking project that only requires common pieces. This is perfect for that. Everything snaps together nicely and the controls are easy to get comfortable with. It is a bit difficult to move/extract with precision. I don't know if there is a snapping threshold, but if not, that would be helpful (to be able to set it to 1/2" for example instead of 1/16") especially for extrusion (EDIT: There is in the settings menu). Would like to have a "shift" key to dynamically turn off snapping when moving objects around (like bolts which are hard to place). Kind of a bummer you have to sign up for an account to save, but I suppose it's a small price to pay for a neat tool like this. I don't really get the "add to cart" feature. This makes me think that some materials will be microtransaction-based in the future. The cart is also hard to find. I only saw it again when I went to reload my project. The Youtube tutorials are nice, but a little clumsy. I still don't know which buttons select the video and which plays. I just kept pressing trigger and A. Also, they are very short, so one longer tutorial would be a nice option... which I think would still be less than 2 minutes total. Still, I like it. And I like the passthrough. It feels very natural to work with. Copying/moving/extruding all feel really good. Thanks dev!
review_2: Thank you for finally making something the everyday user could use and not have to understand a bunch about 3d modeling. I hopped in and real quick was already getting measurements and mocking up a sliding barn door. So helpful in just the first 10 minutes. Easy to use, the prices are to give you an idea of material cost, simply "grab" them from the list and put em either in your pallete or directly into your workspace. Also if tubing or round stock were added this could be huge for automotive roll cage and frame and custom building. Maybe some carving or cutting for the wood and metal and a spray foam to sculpt again for home office or automotive aspects. THIS HAS THE POTENTIAL to bring real time projects to a whole new level or planning and rnr. 5 stars for how effortlessly it was to use and get started and for showing what can be done and hopefully is paving the path for others as well to take note. And it's free?!?!?! Any diyer or even legit contractors could use this.
review_3: Makes building with extrusions much easier and faster
